1.title: About
1.content: Meshtastic® is a project that lets you use inexpensive GPS mesh radios as an extensible, super long battery life mesh GPS communicator. These radios are great for hiking, skiing, paragliding - essentially any hobby where you don’t have reliable internet access. Each member of your private mesh can always see the location and distance of all other members and any text messages sent to your group chat. The radios automatically create a mesh to forward packets as needed, so everyone in the group can receive messages from even the furthest member. The radios will optionally work with your phone, but no phone is required. Typical time between recharging the radios should be about eight days. This project is is currently in beta-testing - if you have questions please join our discussion forum. This software is 100% open source and developed by a group of hobbyist experimenters. No warranty is provided, if you’d like to improve it - we’d love your help. Please post in the chat.

2.title: General Documentation Help
2.content: In addition to the topics above, we have a set of Frequently Asked Questions, and a Glossary to help with any technical terms you may encounter in our documentation.

3.title: Contributions
3.content: If you have anything to fix or details to add, first file an issue on GitHub to see if it is likely to be accepted, then file a pull request with your change (one PR per issue).

5.content: | Name | Description | Download | Documentation | Source Code | . | Meshtastic Android | The official android application for Meshtastic | Google Play | ~Docs~ | Link | . | Meshtastic CLI | The commandline interface for Meshtastic | Included in Meshtastic Python | Docs | Link | . | Meshtastic iOS | The Meshtastic iOS application is still in alpha testing | TestFlight</br>~App Store~ | ~Docs~ | Link | . | Meshtastic Python | The official python API for Meshtastic | sudo pip3 install --upgrade meshtastic | Docs | Link | .

17.title: Troubleshooting
17.content: For any issues during setup, search our forum to find a solution. If you can’t find one, please post your problem, providing as much detail as possible.

22.title: Meshtastic CLI
22.content: Run command meshtastic -h or meshtastic --help to see a partial list of available commands.

23.title: Contents
23.content: . | Bluetooth Settings | Channel Settings | Device Settings | GPS Settings | Ham Radio Settings | WiFi Settings | . </a> . Bluetooth Settings . </a> . Channel Settings . </a> . Device Settings . </a> . GPS Settings . </a> . Ham Radio Settings . </a> . WiFi Settings . | Set WiFi SSID & Password as a WiFi Client meshtastic --set wifi_ap_mode false --set wifi_ssid mywifissid --set wifi_password mywifipassword . | Set WiFi SSID & Password with SoftAP enabled meshtastic --set wifi_ap_mode true --set wifi_ssid mywifissid --set wifi_password mywifipassword . | Disable WiFi meshtastic --set wifi_ap_mode false --set wifi_ssid "" --set wifi_password "" . | .
